<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUPS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/16/us-business-applications-surge-77-q3?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Was the Next Morning Brew Founded Last Month?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Census chart " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODEyL2NlbnN1c19jaGFydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. business applications went <a href="https://www.census.gov/econ/bfs/pdf/bfs_current.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">through the roof</a> last quarter, according to a new report from the Census Bureau. Covidpreneurs filed more than 1.5 million applications for Employer Identification Numbers (EINs) in Q3, a 77.4% increase from Q2.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s not just a big increase from Q2...it’s also a big increase from last year</span><span><em> </em></span><span>(when there wasn’t a pandemic). In late September, business applications passed 3.2 million for 2020. At the same point in 2019, 2.7 million applications had been filed. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, new businesses are being formed at the fastest pace in more than a decade, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/is-it-insane-to-start-a-business-during-coronavirus-millions-of-americans-dont-think-so-11601092841?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the WSJ</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After tens of millions of Americans lost their jobs in the spring, a big chunk of them decided, “Hey, if Musk can do it, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-us-news-pandemics-gardening-fort-lauderdale-da3aa45f001304e459a311d0779b7b13?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so can I</a>.” Because despite what it seems at first glance, a recession is not <em>not</em> a good time to start a business. Consider:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Fed lowered interest rates to near zero, dropping the cost of borrowing money.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There are a lot of available smart people who’ve been let go from their previous jobs.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With businesses shutting down across the country, it’s easier to stand out.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, starting a company is extremely difficult when a pandemic <em>isn’t</em> stalking the globe. Within five years, more than half of new employee businesses fail, and the chances of failure are even greater during tough economic times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, new business <em>applications</em> aren’t a 1:1 measure of new businesses—it just means folks were considering it enough to file an application with the IRS.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>While the number of business applications filed this year is encouraging, newly formed companies won’t come close to replacing those lost during the pandemic.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more,</strong> <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/entrepreneurs-are-like-cockroachesin-a-good-way/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a> has a great episode on this subject.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/16/retail-sales-soar-september-challenges-lie-ahead?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
September Retail Sales: A Matter of Pursepective
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Question mark pushing a cart to represent uncertainty in retail" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjk4L3F1ZXN0aW9uY2FydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Commerce Dept. reported that <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-economy-graphic/strong-retail-sales-boost-optimism-before-u-s-election-but-it-may-be-short-lived-idUSKBN2712N1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retail sales</a> increased a seasonally adjusted 1.9% in September, a healthy bounce that crushed expectations. That caps off five consecutive months of growth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What drove the increase? Most likely a) the government’s $300 supplement to unemployment insurance and b) some people returning to work. Fear of infection on public transit drove consumers to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-economy-september-retail-sales-coronavirus-recovery-11602786924?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spend on vehicles</a>, while we also dropped cash on credenzas and second offices as part of the WFH revolution.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consider the report an attaboy from the U.S. economy’s supervisor...paired with “opportunities for improvement” in categories like clothing and restaurant spending, both of which are still way below last year’s levels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>things look iffy; infections are rising, job growth is stagnating, and the number of Americans filing for unemployment insurance just reached a two-month high. Not to mention, another round of stimulus from D.C. is appearing about as likely as a Michael Bay Oscar win.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/16/covid19-vaccines-treatments-weeks-developments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid-19 Vaccines and Treatments Hurry Up and Wait
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right now, the health sector resembles a gaggle of wizards and witches broom-zooming after two different airborne balls: a Covid-19 treatment (think of it like the Quaffle) and a vaccine (the Snitch). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two treatment possibilities suffered setbacks this week: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Eli Lilly </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/14/health/covid-clinical-trials.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paused</a></span><span> the trial of its antibody drug. Experts say that for the kind of trial it was carrying out, the company must have had serious safety concerns to justify hitting the brakes. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The WHO found that remdesivir, another potential treatment and one that was given to President Trump, has “</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/16/who-remdesivir-has-little-or-no-effect-in-reducing-covid-19-deaths.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">little or no effect</a></span><span>” on patients’ chances of survival. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And one potential vaccine provider preached patience: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-donald-trump-europe-54b77dd8c1a84a3e2a3a8d11dc2a0646?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> that, even if everything goes Gentleman Jack-smoothly, the company won’t be able to request emergency authorization of its vaccine before the third week of November—so at least a month out. Companies have to prove their vaccines’ safety (i.e. lack of dangerous side effects) in addition to effectiveness, which takes time. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The most optimistic scenario is an approved vaccine by the end of the year, which would then be distributed in strictly limited quantities.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BEVERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/16/coke-retires-tab-50-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tab Joins Coke’s Walking Dead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Walking Dead" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ov9kam2rQIudkg1qg/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Walking Dead" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ov9kam2rQIudkg1qg/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coca-Cola is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/16/coca-cola-to-retire-tab-as-it-trims-its-portfolio-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retiring</a> its OG diet cola, Tab, after more than 50 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If some of you younger readers are thinking, “What’s Tab?” that’s exactly the point. The drink was popular back in the ’70s, but Diet Coke <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tab-coca-colas-diet-soda-pioneer-and-a-70s-icon-is-going-away-11602847800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">usurped its throne</a> and in 2019 Tab represented a grand total of 0.1% of global diet cola sales. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tab is another of Coke’s “zombie” brands. </strong>In Q2’s earnings call, Coke CEO James Quincey said over half of the company’s 400 brands had “little to no scale” and accounted for only <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/21/business/coke-zombie-brands-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2% of the company’s total revenue</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So Quincey is going full <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/08/cocacola-cuts-zombie-brands-portfolio?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Shaun of the Dead</em></a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the first half of 2019, Coke </span><span><a href="https://www.marketingweek.com/coca-cola-cut-zombie-brands/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phased out</a></span><span> more than 275 products.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Earlier this year, Coke said it would discontinue other zombie brands: Zico coconut water and smoothie drink Odwalla. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> If Coke is making some products feel like Woody in the first <em>Toy Story</em>, it’s because Buzz Lightyear is on the way. The company is extra bullish on its sparkling mineral water Topo Chico, and plans to release an alcoholic version next year.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Saturday Headlines

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This food-themed Saturday Headlines is 50% the result of weird food headlines, 50% because of how hungry we are right now. We’ll present you with three real news stories and one we made up—can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Dunkin' adds a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/14/business/ghost-pepper-spicy-donut-dunkin-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spicy donut</a></span><span> for the first time ever”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Hershey’s edible face masks </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/D2t94jSqtrVe0/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make their debut</a></span><span> ahead of Halloween”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

mso-padding-alt: 0px 15px 15px 5px;\"\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBudget: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe budget deficit for the 2020 fiscal year \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/16/us-government-budget-ends-fiscal-year-with-a-more-than-3-trillion-deficit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit $3.1 trillion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, more than triple last year’s gap and most definitely a record. Government stimulus funds aimed to help people and businesses hurt by the pandemic are behind the shortfall.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/15/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFriday’s close\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the S\u0026P and the Dow have now gone up and to the right for three consecutive weeks; the Nasdaq for four.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSTARTUPS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/16/us-business-applications-surge-77-q3?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWas the Next Morning Brew Founded Last Month?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Census chart \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODEyL2NlbnN1c19jaGFydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. business applications went \u003ca href=\"https://www.census.gov/econ/bfs/pdf/bfs_current.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethrough the roof\u003c/a\u003e last quarter, according to a new report from the Census Bureau. Covidpreneurs filed more than 1.5 million applications for Employer Identification Numbers (EINs) in Q3, a 77.4% increase from Q2.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s not just a big increase from Q2...it’s also a big increase from last year\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e(when there wasn’t a pandemic). In late September, business applications passed 3.2 million for 2020. At the same point in 2019, 2.7 million applications had been filed. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, new businesses are being formed at the fastest pace in more than a decade, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/is-it-insane-to-start-a-business-during-coronavirus-millions-of-americans-dont-think-so-11601092841?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter tens of millions of Americans lost their jobs in the spring, a big chunk of them decided, “Hey, if Musk can do it, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-us-news-pandemics-gardening-fort-lauderdale-da3aa45f001304e459a311d0779b7b13?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eso can I\u003c/a\u003e.” Because despite what it seems at first glance, a recession is not \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e a good time to start a business. Consider:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Fed lowered interest rates to near zero, dropping the cost of borrowing money.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere are a lot of available smart people who’ve been let go from their previous jobs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith businesses shutting down across the country, it’s easier to stand out.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, starting a company is extremely difficult when a pandemic \u003cem\u003eisn’t\u003c/em\u003e stalking the globe. Within five years, more than half of new employee businesses fail, and the chances of failure are even greater during tough economic times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, new business \u003cem\u003eapplications\u003c/em\u003e aren’t a 1:1 measure of new businesses—it just means folks were considering it enough to file an application with the IRS.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the number of business applications filed this year is encouraging, newly formed companies won’t come close to replacing those lost during the pandemic.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more,\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.businesscasual.fm/entrepreneurs-are-like-cockroachesin-a-good-way/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBusiness Casual\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e has a great episode on this subject.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Commerce Dept. reported that \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-economy-graphic/strong-retail-sales-boost-optimism-before-u-s-election-but-it-may-be-short-lived-idUSKBN2712N1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretail sales\u003c/a\u003e increased a seasonally adjusted 1.9% in September, a healthy bounce that crushed expectations. That caps off five consecutive months of growth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat drove the increase? Most likely a) the government’s $300 supplement to unemployment insurance and b) some people returning to work. Fear of infection on public transit drove consumers to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-economy-september-retail-sales-coronavirus-recovery-11602786924?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espend on vehicles\u003c/a\u003e, while we also dropped cash on credenzas and second offices as part of the WFH revolution.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsider the report an attaboy from the U.S. economy’s supervisor...paired with “opportunities for improvement” in categories like clothing and restaurant spending, both of which are still way below last year’s levels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethings look iffy; infections are rising, job growth is stagnating, and the number of Americans filing for unemployment insurance just reached a two-month high. Not to mention, another round of stimulus from D.C. is appearing about as likely as a Michael Bay Oscar win.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight now, the health sector resembles a gaggle of wizards and witches broom-zooming after two different airborne balls: a Covid-19 treatment (think of it like the Quaffle) and a vaccine (the Snitch). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo treatment possibilities suffered setbacks this week: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEli Lilly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/14/health/covid-clinical-trials.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaused\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the trial of its antibody drug. Experts say that for the kind of trial it was carrying out, the company must have had serious safety concerns to justify hitting the brakes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe WHO found that remdesivir, another potential treatment and one that was given to President Trump, has “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/16/who-remdesivir-has-little-or-no-effect-in-reducing-covid-19-deaths.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elittle or no effect\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” on patients’ chances of survival. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd one potential vaccine provider preached patience: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-donald-trump-europe-54b77dd8c1a84a3e2a3a8d11dc2a0646?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that, even if everything goes Gentleman Jack-smoothly, the company won’t be able to request emergency authorization of its vaccine before the third week of November—so at least a month out. Companies have to prove their vaccines’ safety (i.e. lack of dangerous side effects) in addition to effectiveness, which takes time. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe most optimistic scenario is an approved vaccine by the end of
